original_text:
**INSTITUTION
Discharge Summary
Name :
**NAME[AAA , BBB]
Acct # :
**ID-NUM
MRN :
**ID-NUM
Admitted :
**DATE[Jun 10 2007]
Discharged :
**DATE[Jun 12 2007]
Dict :
**NAME[XXX , WWW]
Attend :
**NAME[ZZZ , YYY]
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSIS :
Coronary artery disease .
SECONDARY DIAGNOSES :
1. Status post coronary artery bypass graft surgery previously .
2. Hypertension .
3. Hyperlipidemia .
4. Tobacco abuse .
5. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease .
PRINCIPAL PROCEDURES DONE :
1. Heart catheterization with graft visualization .
2. In-stent to the RCA , Mini-Driver stent by Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] on **DATE[Jun 10 2007] .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
This is a **AGE[in 60s]- year-old female patient seen recently in the office by Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] , who underwent a stress echocardiogram for anginal symptoms .
This was positive , had previous history of bypass surgery several years ago , out of state .
The patient was admitted for elective catheterization with PCI .
The patient underwent heart catheterization on **DATE[Jun 10 2007] , results of which showed a patent , but very short left main coronary artery ; a proximal 90% to 95% stenosis of the LAD , dominant left circumflex artery with a 50% stenosis of the small first obtuse marginal branch with segmental ostial and proximal 60% to 70% stenosis of the small second obtuse marginal branch with mild luminal irregularities in the distal portion of that vessel , and nondominant right coronary artery with a proximal 99% stenosis .
Coronary artery bypass graft showed a patent saphenous vein graft to the first and second diagonal branches of the LAD .
Patent left internal mammary artery graft to the LAD , left ventricular hypertrophy with a normal systolic and diastolic left ventricular function .
The patient underwent successful angioplasty and stent to the right coronary artery with a Mini-Driver stent .
The patient did well post procedure , did have a small right groin hematoma and some ecchymoses .
Pressure dressing was applied .
The patient 's labs remained stable .
Her H and H were 11.2 and 32.8 .
The patient did have mild increase in troponin , post procedure 0.17 , this has to be repeated .
The patient is also to have EKG prior to discharge .
The patient to follow up with Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] in 4 weeks .
The patient to follow up with her primary care provider , Dr. **NAME[VVV UUU] as per his schedule , his fax is **PHONE .
MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE :
Include :
1. Xanax 0.5 mg p.o. b.i.d.
2. Aspirin 325 mg p.o. daily .
3. Lipitor 80 mg p.o. daily at bedtime .
4. Plavix 75 mg p.o. daily .
5. Prozac 20 mg p.o. daily .
6. Lisinopril 40 mg p.o. daily .
7. Nitro-Dur patch 0.4 mg / hr , apply topically daily , off at bedtime .
8. Nitroglycerin sublingual tablets 0.4 mg as needed for chest pain .
For more detailed records , please see the patient 's medical chart .
______________________________
**NAME[WWW XXX] , CRNP
HS Job # 669209 / 41478 / 35760
SHY # **ID-NUM
D :
**DATE[Jun 12 2007] 08:43
T :
**DATE[Jun 12 2007] 21:37
**CARBON-COPY
